medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent infections and severely eczematous skin leading to hospitalization.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1, an 18-month-old boy, developed eczema shortly after birth that has not resolved. He has recurrent infections including pneumonia and staphylococcal abscesses. Patient 2, a 15-year-old boy, has a long-standing history of HIES diagnosed at 18 months with multiple episodes of cold abscesses and sinusitis but has maintained excellent control on a regimen of therapies.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 has a history of atopic dermatitis and three prior hospitalizations for pneumonia. Patient 2 has a history of recurrent MRSA cold abscesses, sinusitis, and pneumonia. No other significant past medical history provided.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1's mother has a history of mild asthma; otherwise, no significant family history noted. Patient 2's mother has severe life-long recalcitrant eczema, with no other family members affected.
